resources.string: You can restrict who can answer you survey by protecting it with a password. Only users who enter the password can submit their answer
You need to enter a name
You need to enter a longer name

In addition to usual poll responses, you can get more info:

Private votes: you will know who and what voted and what.
Anonymous votes: you will know who voted, but not what.
Secret votes: you won\'t know who voted.
You can protect your poll with a password. Users will have to enter it in order to answer.

string-array.name: array_privacy_explained
string-array.item: Votes will be public. You will be able to know if someone completed the questionnaire and the answers.
Votes will be anonymous. You will if someone did complete the questionnaire, but not the answers.
Votes will be secret. You will only be able to know how many completed the questionnaire.
